intro: Stigmatocarpum criniflorum, commonly known as the silky flax or silky flaxtree, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, fluffy flowers that resemble small clouds, which are borne on long, slender stalks. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Stigmatocarpum criniflorum is typically found in moist, tropical environments and is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its striking appearance.
